title: 1967 Ford Bronco

description: 1967 Ford Bronco Half Cab For Sale in Newbern, North Carolina 28562

Get ready to capture everyone's attention behind the wheel of this 1967 Ford Bronco!  This multi-purpose vehicle features the strong and stately styling for which the Bronco nameplate is known.  It has been dressed in beautiful Inferno Red paint and complemented by a gray and red interior.  Powered by a 1969 model Windsor 351 V-8 engine that is mated with a C-4 automatic transmission, that were professionally done in 2001, this four by four off-road vehicle is eager to take you anywhere your heart desires.  With only 7,000 miles on the new engine, you can rest assured that this handsome devil will provide an enjoyable driving experience for many years to come.

The Ford Bronco was first built for the 1966 model year and was considered Ford's first compact SUV.  This 1967 model Bronco comes fully loaded with options and features that are perfect for anyone who appreciates freshly updated classics.  Highlights of this Bronco's advantages include:
Red - Gray Vinyl interior. - Custom seats - headliner
C-4 Automatic transmission.
1969 model 351 Windsor engine approx 350 HP
With MSD. ignition, headers, holly carburetor, and mild cam. Professional rebuild. Sounds and runs good.
411 gears
Limited slip diff.
All new springs, duel shocks, new bushings, tie rods, drag link, track bar etc.
New fuel tank, and fuel lines
NEW: brake lines, rear drum breaks, - front power disk breaks
NEW: steering shaft, steering column, - steering wheel
Rebuilt power steering gear box and pump
Aluminum radiator
Painless wiring system, new lens and bezels
Rebuilt Heater
Custom made metal dash
All new gauges including the radio
Electric Windshield Wipers
All new tinted glass
33x12.50x15 inch wheels and tires

This 1967 Ford Bronco Half Cab has been very well maintained and always garage kept.  It has had the same owner for 21 years now and is a must see/drive to truly appreciate everything it has to offer.  In fact, come see for yourself!  You will agree that you cannot find another '67 Bronco in this condition for the asking price.  Very few 1967 Broncos are still on the road.  Fewer still is the number of road-worthy drivers in such great condition as this one.  Priced to sell, so don't delay!  Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this iconic classic half cab!

Very original 1978 Ford Bronco.  Black on Red are the original colors.    Interior is all original, but the truck was resprayed 1 time.  We do have a signed affidavit from the previous owner stating the miles are original.  This has some rare items from the factory.  This is a ranger XLT with the XLT trim being deleted.  It also has factory roll cage.  The 400M V8 engine was recently rebuilt and the truck runs excellent.    It drives just as good and is very tight and drives straight and true.  The Heavy Duty C6 Transmission shifts perfectly.   6 Inch Suspension Lift and nice wheels and tires really set this Bronco off and give it a great look.  One unique item is the moon roof which was dealer installed shortly after being purchased in 1978-79.
Options include Power Brakes (front disc, power steering, am/fm radio.  Everything is working exactly like it should be.  Complete pictures and video at www.4-wheelclassics.com.
Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1971 Ford Bronco. Lifted 4x4. Full Soft Top. Great Condition. Must see!
HISTORY

The original Bronco was an ORV (Off-Road Vehicle), intended to compete primarily with Jeep CJ models and the International Harvester Scout. The Bronco's small size riding on a 92-inch (2,337 mm) wheelbase made it maneuverable for some uses, but impractical as a tow vehicle. The Bronco was Ford's first compact SUV.

The idea behind the Bronco began with Ford product manager Donald N. Frey, who also conceived the Ford Mustang; and similarly, Lee Iacoccapushed the idea through into production. In many ways, the Bronco was a more original concept than the Mustang; whereas the Mustang was based upon the Ford Falcon, the Bronco had a frame, suspension, and a body that were not shared with any other vehicle.  SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA
SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION
EXTERIOR
-Dark Green Paint.
-Winch.
-Full Soft Top.
-Heavy Duty Bumpers.
-35" Radial Tires.
-2" Body Lift Kit.
-Great Stance.
INTERIOR
-Matching White Vinyl front buckets and rear bench.
-Tilt column.
-Roll Cage.
-Rhino Lined floors.
MECHANICAL
-Ford 302 V8 with Howell Fuel Injection System.
-C-4 Automatic Transmission.
-4 Core Radiator.
-Dana 20 transfer case.
-Dana 44 front axle.
-Trutrac Modulation limited slip 9" rear end.
-Front Disc Brakes with Hyrdoboost.
-Saginaw Power Steering.
DISCLOSURE
-There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint, cracks in dashboard, crack in OD lens, repair in soft top and stains on seat. (See detailed pictures)
For more details on any disclosure items please contact a sales agent today at 1-877-422-2940.

1. Vintage trucks and 4x4’s! Pinzgauer, Unimog, Defender, Bronco, Land Cruiser FJ40 FJ45 FJ55, International Scout, Jeep Willys, Dodge Power Wagon, Nissan Patrol, Ford Truck 4x4s, Chevy Truck 4x4s, NAPCO, Marmon Herrington, etc.

We would love to meet you in person and encourage you to come see the vehicles before you buy!  If you cannot meet a salesman during business hours please call the main office, and one of the owners will meet you Monday through Saturday.

Please check your local state inspection requirements. We do our best to inspect these vehicles in every detail, and note any imperfections in the advertisement. PLEASE NOTE THAT WE DO NOT GUARANTEE ANY AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEMS, GAUGES, OR ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS.  GIVEN THE NATURE OF THE VINTAGE VEHICLES WE SELL, THESE COMPONENTS CAN BE WORKING AT ONE MOMENT AND NOT WORKING AT ANOTHER MOMENT. IT IS COMMON THAT THESE COMPONENTS WILL NEED UPKEEP OR ATTENTION. IN ADDITION, MANY TIMES THESE VEHICLES SIT FOR LONG PERIODS OF TIME AND ONCE YOU BEGIN TO DRIVE THEM SEALS HARDEN AND GASKETS MAY BEGIN TO LEAK! CLASSIC CARS LEAK. PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU ARE COMFORTABLE WITH THIS BEFORE BUYING A VINTAGE AUTOMOBILE.  Please call a sales expert to get details on these systems 1-877-422-2940.
CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or “driver quality” restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We provide approximately 75 HD images, and an HD video, in every one of our listings.  Very few companies offer this much detail.  We spend significant time inspecting and disclosing detailed items on all of our vehicles; however, at the end of the day, we are not you... we highly suggest that you come and inspect the vehicle.

The information contained in this ad is solely for convenience.  The description is an opinion only and should not be considered a complete description of any or all faults; it may not be relied upon nor taken as fact or otherwise a representation or warranty of any sort.  Please note, we did NOT build or restore the vehicle. Vehicles are sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with all faults known/unknown and with no implied warranty.  Unless shown in the photographs, we do NOT have documentation, receipts, or photographs of the vehicle listed.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.

1984 bronco XLT 351cu in. Great shape everything works. Pictures will tell the story. was  302 replaced with a 351 new paint job ,no rust body has been reworked,new ties. garage kept. runs great and solid on the road. I have 3 other suv's and it sits in the garage. I owned it from 89 to now.

A real U14 half cab that we have done a frame on restoration.  Appears to have all original drivetrain including the 6 cyl and 3 speed manual transmission.  The body has been blasted to bare metal and all rust was fix with new metal. It has all new weatherstrip, new seat covers and dash pad and steering wheel.   The floor has been done in bedliner and the underneath has been detailed with undercoating and painted black.  The truck runs and drives great.  Wipers have been converted to electric, only works on 1 speed.  These are very hard to find.  Our own shop did the restoration and we do very good quality work as can be seen by our trophy's from local car shows.  You are dealing with the restorer not a salesman so I can give you all the details of the Bronco's restoration.  Besides doing the body it goes thru our mechanical shop and we rebuilt the carb, new headlights, new tailpipe, replaced the oil pan gasket, near new wheels and tires.  We also inspect all drivetrain components.   Call for more pictures or video.  Located in White,SD.

You can Buy With Confidence since we have been in the car business for 30 years.  We are a family business and will not sell you anything you don't want.  All of our vehicles are inspected and we will tell you anything that isn't working.  We have around 100 pictures and a video of our classics on our web site http://www.bnbautosales.com.  If you need anything don't hesitate to email or call as we will get any picture or another video to you.  We work and drive these cars so can personally tell you about the car.

Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1974 Ford Bronco. Rare uncut! Power steering, Power brakes, Vintage Air Conditioning, 302 V8!!!
HISTORY

The original Bronco was an ORV (Off-Road Vehicle), intended to compete primarily with Jeep CJ models and the International Harvester Scout. The Bronco's small size riding on a 92-inch (2,337 mm) wheelbase made it maneuverable for some uses, but impractical as a tow vehicle. The Bronco was Ford's first compact SUV.

The idea behind the Bronco began with Ford product manager Donald N. Frey, who also conceived the Ford Mustang; and similarly, Lee Iacocca pushed the idea through into production. In many ways, the Bronco was a more original concept than the Mustang; whereas the Mustang was based upon the Ford Falcon, the Bronco had a frame, suspension, and a body that were not shared with any other vehicle. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA
SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION
EXTERIOR
-Uncut original 1974 bronco in period correct two tone pine green and white.
-Chrome runners, seam trim, bumpers and grill all in suburb shape.
-Factory hardtop.
-Covered rear spare and swing gate.
-215/75R15 tires with plenty of tread.
INTERIOR
-Matching front and rear reupholstered seats in excellent condition.
-Door panels, dash, headliner - all in great shape.
-Clean, matching beige carpet throughout, including cargo area.
MECHANICAL
-Strong running 302 motor.
-Automatic transmission.
-Fully functional 4x4, original transfer case.
-Power steering.
-Power brakes (disc up front).
-Air Conditioning.
DISCLOSURE
-There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint and body. Minor bubbling on rear seam. No rot. (See detailed pictures)
-Air conditioning system complete but does not blow cold. Needs recharge.

PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU ARE COMFORTABLE WITH THIS BEFORE BUYING A VINTAGE AUTOMOBILE.  Please call a sales expert to get details on these systems 1-877-422-2940.
CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or “driver quality” restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1971 Ford Bronco.  We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks like this and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare Bronco!
HISTORY

“The Ford Bronco is a sports utility vehicle (SUV) manufactured and marketed by Ford from 1966 to 1996, over five generations.The Bronco was introduced in 1966 as a competitor to the small four-wheel-drive compact SUVs that included the Jeep CJ-5 and International Harvester Scout, and it was built on its own platform. A major redesign in 1978 moved the Bronco to a larger size, using a shortened Ford F-Series truck chassis to compete with both the similarly adapted Chevy K5 Blazer, as well as the Dodge Ramcharger. Most Broncos are usually equipped with a Spare tire swing away carrier found on the outside of the rear end door. From 1966 to 1986 Broncos were produced at Ford's Michigan Truck Plant in Wayne, Michigan. From 1987 to 1996 Broncos were produced in Venezuela and are marketed as imports to the United States.”-Wikipedia

EXTERIOR

-Custom steel front bumper.

-BRAND NEW SOFT TOP!
INTERIOR

-Brand new rear bench seat.
-Professionally Rhino-lined interior.
-Original style Ford gauges.
-Painted Dash.
-Ford steering wheels.
-Locking steel center console.
-Roll bar.
MECHANICAL
-Ford 302 V8. Runs strong. Estimated 32K on rebuild.
-Dual exhaust.
-Power steering.
DISCLOSURE

-Small chip in the windshield. (See detailed pictures)
-Tires have plenty of tread. Front tires and rear tires have different tread.

Perhaps no other early 4WD has captured the American Spirit as the Ford Bronco. The Ford Bronco was an instant hit when it was introduced in 1966 as a rugged, simple and economical compact SUV. The Bronco soon had a reputation for having many utility type uses as well as superior off road capability.

The 1972 Ford Bronco offered her for your consideration is badged as a ''Bronco Sport.'' The Bronco was just freshly restored.  The truck came to us from North Carolina.  Cosmetically the Bronco shows very well, with the chrome and trim in great shape.  The interior is finished in black vinyl and looks great with no sign of wear.  The truck is also has a roll bar.  According to the previous owner, the 302 v8 engine was rebuilt, new radiator, new radiator hoses, new painless wiring, new alternator, new dash pad, new power steering, new power brakes(disc in front), new brake lines, new fuel tanks and fuel lines, new u joints, new shocks and springs, new rims and tires as well.  There is no documentation of records to show that this has all been done.  The Bronco also has a 4 barrel Edelbrock carburetor, Bosch oil pressre/temperature/voltage gauges, dual exhaust and more.  The Bronco has a 3 speed manual transmission.
As vintage truck and SUV's rise in value steadily, this Bronco is a must have for any collector or enthusiast.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.
1973 Ford Bronco

with minimal rust, all original unmolested sheet metal and paint. Airport find. Long-term owner left at Sturgis, SD airport for personal use when he flew in. It has a 302 V8, automatic, power steering, factory 9-inch positraction rear end with Dana front end. Radio, 2-speed wipers, 2 gas tanks, chrome side trim. The Bronco was last licensed in 2002. In July, 2017, 302 was freshened up with new spark plugs, carburetor kit, belts, brakes, timing chain and gear, fuel pump, water pump, oil filter, all fluid levels and zerks. New seats, armrests. Wipers, windows, blinkers, radio, lights and 4 x 4 all work well. Horn, windshield, rocker panels still need attention.
Pioneer Auto Museum
MURDO, SD
http://www.pioneerautoshow.com

title: 1967 Ford Bronco

description: 1967 Ford Bronco Half Cab For Sale in Newbern, North Carolina 28562

Get ready to capture everyone's attention behind the wheel of this 1967 Ford Bronco!  This multi-purpose vehicle features the strong and stately styling for which the Bronco nameplate is known.  It has been dressed in beautiful Inferno Red paint and complemented by a gray and red interior.  Powered by a 1969 model Windsor 351 V-8 engine that is mated with a C-4 automatic transmission, that were professionally done in 2001, this four by four off-road vehicle is eager to take you anywhere your heart desires.  With only 7,000 miles on the new engine, you can rest assured that this handsome devil will provide an enjoyable driving experience for many years to come.

The Ford Bronco was first built for the 1966 model year and was considered Ford's first compact SUV.  This 1967 model Bronco comes fully loaded with options and features that are perfect for anyone who appreciates freshly updated classics.  Highlights of this Bronco's advantages include:
Red - Gray Vinyl interior. - Custom seats - headliner
C-4 Automatic transmission.
1969 model 351 Windsor engine approx 350 HP
With MSD. ignition, headers, holly carburetor, and mild cam. Professional rebuild. Sounds and runs good.
411 gears
Limited slip diff.
All new springs, duel shocks, new bushings, tie rods, drag link, track bar etc.
New fuel tank, and fuel lines
NEW: brake lines, rear drum breaks, - front power disk breaks
NEW: steering shaft, steering column, - steering wheel
Rebuilt power steering gear box and pump
Aluminum radiator
Painless wiring system, new lens and bezels
Rebuilt Heater
Custom made metal dash
All new gauges including the radio
Electric Windshield Wipers
All new tinted glass
33x12.50x15 inch wheels and tires

This 1967 Ford Bronco Half Cab has been very well maintained and always garage kept.  It has had the same owner for 21 years now and is a must see/drive to truly appreciate everything it has to offer.  In fact, come see for yourself!  You will agree that you cannot find another '67 Bronco in this condition for the asking price.  Very few 1967 Broncos are still on the road.  Fewer still is the number of road-worthy drivers in such great condition as this one.  Priced to sell, so don't delay!  Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this iconic classic half cab!!!
View this vehicle here:
1967 Ford Bronco Half Cab
Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this restored, super clean and highly optioned 1974 Ford Bronco 4x4.  Convertible top. Must See!
HISTORY

The original Bronco was an ORV (Off-Road Vehicle), intended to compete primarily with Jeep CJ models and the International Harvester Scout. The Bronco's small size riding on a 92-inch (2,337 mm) wheelbase made it maneuverable for some uses, but impractical as a tow vehicle. The Bronco was Ford's first compact SUV.

The idea behind the Bronco began with Ford product manager Donald N. Frey, who also conceived the Ford Mustang; and similarly, Lee Iacocca pushed the idea through into production. In many ways, the Bronco was a more original concept than the Mustang; whereas the Mustang was based upon the Ford Falcon, the Bronco had a frame, suspension, and a body that were not shared with any other vehicle. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

INTERIOR
-Bucket Seats.
-Rear Bench.
-Aftermarket Critical Gauges.
MECHANICAL
-Automatic Transmission.
-Power Steering.
DISCLOSURE
-There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint and body. Tear in seat. Hard Top door does not have struts. Interior door panels are cout out for speakers. (See detailed pictures)

CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or “driver quality” restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We provide approximately 75 HD images, and an HD video, in every one of our listings.  Very few companies offer this much detail.  We spend significant time inspecting and disclosing detailed items on all of our vehicles; however, at the end of the day, we are not you... we highly suggest that you come and inspect the vehicle.

The information contained in this ad is solely for convenience.  The description is an opinion only and should not be considered a complete description of any or all faults; it may not be relied upon nor taken as fact or otherwise a representation or warranty of any sort.  Please note, we did NOT build or restore the vehicle. Vehicles are sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with all faults known/unknown and with no implied warranty.  Unless shown in the photographs, we do NOT have documentation, receipts, or photographs of the vehicle listed.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.

I bought this Bronco in 1985.  I am the third owner.  It has 36000 original miles.  It was originally Red and White.  I repainted it in 1985.  It needs a new floor pan.  It runs great.  Original everything, except paint.  I have the original tires and wheels and original steering wheel.  This Bronco has been shedded since 1985.

Very rare 4-wheel drive, 1/2 cab Bronco with factory 302 ci V8-engine and 3-speed manual transmission.Been in same family since purchased new and been in New Mexico past 30 years. The engine has some modifications and sounds great! Equipped with air conditioning, hard tonneau cover and bucket seats. It runs incredible!
